lines.text: New York. I want to go to New York.
You'll want to go by Buffalo.
No, I want to go by *train*!

[as Elmer Truffle snores loudly]
Well, I don't know how you could marry a man that snores that way.

[laughing]
It was too late when I found it out.

[to her daughter Vivian]
Aw, come, pull yourself together, darling. Forget all about it. I tell you, there isn't a man in the world worth worrying about. I got to go up now. Your papa's in bed again with his stomach. I'm worried to death about him.
Lindbergh to take me flying, but I couldn't go.

[at the train station searching franticly under her blouse for her pocketbook]
Oh, there she is. It slipped. Oh, my land. Now how am I going to get it? Oh, what am I going to do?
You can *not*! There's no fool like an old fool.
